valueFormat.notes: Message text displayed in the toast. Keep concise (1-2 sentences max). Can include HTML if preventXss is properly configured. Use action-oriented language.
valueFormat.example: 'Campaign saved successfully' 'Error: Unable to connect to server' '3 items added to cart' 'Warning: Changes not saved'

commonMistakes.why: Toasts auto-dismiss and users don't have time to read long text
commonMistakes.fix: Keep to 1-2 short sentences, max 60-80 characters

valueFormat.notes: Toast variant determining color scheme and semantic meaning. Common values: 'light' (default, neutral), 'success' (green), 'error' (red), 'warning' (yellow/orange), 'info' (blue). Affects background color and default icon.
valueFormat.example:
'success' // Green, checkmark icon
'error' // Red, error icon
'warning' // Orange, warning icon
'info' // Blue, info icon
'light' // Neutral (default)

valueFormat.notes: Controls toast visibility. Set to true to show toast, false to hide. Use v-model:status for reactive control. Toast typically auto-dismisses after timeout.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show toast
false // Hide toast

valueFormat.notes: Custom icon name from Insider icon system. Overrides default type-based icon. Leave empty to use default icon based on type (success=checkmark, error=alert, etc.).
valueFormat.example:
'' // Use default type icon
'check-circle' // Custom success icon
'alert-triangle' // Custom warning icon
'info-circle' // Custom info icon

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows icon alongside text. Set false for text-only toasts without icon. Icons help users quickly identify toast type (success, error, etc.).
valueFormat.example:
true // Show icon (default)
false // Text-only toast

valueFormat.structure: Array<{ text: string; variant?: string; onClick: Function; }>
valueFormat.notes: Array of action buttons shown in toast. Each button has text (label), optional variant (button style), and onClick handler. Use for actionable toasts like 'Undo', 'Retry', 'View Details'.

commonMistakes.why: Toasts have limited space and auto-dismiss
commonMistakes.impact: Cluttered UI, users can't click all buttons before toast dismisses

valueFormat.notes: When true, sanitizes HTML in text prop to prevent XSS attacks. MUST be true if text contains any user-generated content or HTML from untrusted sources.
valueFormat.example:
true // Sanitize HTML
false // No sanitization (default)

commonMistakes.mistake: Showing user input in toast without preventXss=true
commonMistakes.why: User input can contain malicious HTML/scripts
commonMistakes.fix: Always use preventXss=true when text includes user-generated content

valueFormat.notes: When true, removes left margin/padding. Use when positioning toast in custom containers where default spacing isn't needed.
valueFormat.example:
true // Remove left margin
false // Default spacing (default)

basicToast.title: Basic Success Toast
basicToast.code:
<template>
  <InToasts
    v-model:status="showToast"
    text="Campaign saved successfully"
    type="success"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const showToast = ref(false);

const saveCampaign = async () => {
  await api.save();
  showToast.value = true;
  
  // Auto-dismiss after 3 seconds
  setTimeout(() => {
    showToast.value = false;
  }, 3000);
};
</script>

toastWithAction.title: Toast with Action Buttons
toastWithAction.code:
<template>
  <InToasts
    v-model:status="showToast"
    :text="toastMessage"
    type="success"
    :actionButtonsConfig="[
      { text: 'Undo', variant: 'secondary', onClick: handleUndo }
    ]"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const showToast = ref(false);
const toastMessage = ref('');
let deletedItem = null;

const deleteItem = (item) => {
  deletedItem = item;
  // Perform delete
  api.delete(item.id);
  
  toastMessage.value = `${item.name} deleted`;
  showToast.value = true;
  
  setTimeout(() => {
    showToast.value = false;
    deletedItem = null;
  }, 5000);
};

const handleUndo = () => {
  if (deletedItem) {
    api.restore(deletedItem.id);
    showToast.value = false;
  }
};
</script>

errorToastWithRetry.title: Error Toast with Retry
errorToastWithRetry.code:
<template>
  <InToasts
    v-model:status="showErrorToast"
    text="Failed to save campaign"
    type="error"
    :actionButtonsConfig="[
      { text: 'Retry', variant: 'primary', onClick: retrySave }
    ]"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const showErrorToast = ref(false);

const saveCampaign = async () => {
  try {
    await api.save();
  } catch (error) {
    showErrorToast.value = true;
  }
};

const retrySave = () => {
  showErrorToast.value = false;
  saveCampaign();
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Toast with Undo Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Allow users to undo destructive actions before they're committed
implementationPatterns.when: Destructive actions like delete, archive, bulk operations. Gives users safety net to reverse mistakes.

implementationPatterns.name: Stacked Toast Queue
implementationPatterns.description: Show multiple toasts simultaneously in a stack
implementationPatterns.when: Multiple operations happening simultaneously (batch processing, websocket notifications). Users need to see all updates.
cons: Can overwhelm screen with many toasts

useCases.title: CRUD Operation Feedback
useCases.example: User saves a campaign: show 'Campaign saved successfully' (success). User deletes item: show 'Item deleted' with Undo button (success + action).

useCases.title: Form Validation Results
useCases.description: Notify users of validation errors or successful submission
useCases.example: Form submit fails validation: show 'Please fix 3 errors' (error). Form saves successfully: show 'Form submitted' (success).

useCases.title: Background Task Completion
useCases.description: Notify when async operations complete (exports, imports, processing)
useCases.example: Data export starts: show 'Exporting...' (info). Export completes: show 'Export ready' with Download button (success + action). Export fails: show 'Export failed' with Retry button (error + action).

useCases.title: Real-Time Notifications
useCases.description: Display incoming notifications from websockets or polling
useCases.example: New message received: show 'New message from John' with View button (info + action). System maintenance scheduled: show 'Scheduled maintenance in 10 minutes' (warning).

bestPractices.title: Keep Messages Concise
bestPractices.description: Toast messages should be 1-2 short sentences, max 60-80 characters
bestPractices.reasoning: Toasts auto-dismiss after 3-5 seconds. Users don't have time to read long messages. Brief messages are clearer.

bestPractices.title: Use Appropriate Types for Context
bestPractices.description: Match toast type to action result - success for confirmations, error for failures
bestPractices.code:
// Good:
type="success" // for save, create, complete
type="error" // for failures, errors
type="warning" // for cautions, non-critical issues
type="info" // for FYI messages

// Bad:
type="light" // for everything
bestPractices.reasoning: Color coding helps users quickly understand message severity. Consistent type usage builds user expectations.

bestPractices.title: Limit Action Buttons to 1-2 Maximum
bestPractices.description: Too many buttons clutter toast and users can't click before auto-dismiss
bestPractices.reasoning: Limited space and auto-dismiss timing. Users can only reasonably interact with 1-2 buttons before toast disappears.

bestPractices.title: Adjust Duration Based on Importance
bestPractices.description: Critical errors stay longer, simple confirmations dismiss quickly
bestPractices.code:
// Quick dismissal (2-3s):
success toasts: 3000ms
info toasts: 3000ms

// Longer duration (5-7s):
error toasts: 5000ms
warning toasts: 5000ms
toasts with actions: 5000ms+
bestPractices.reasoning: Errors need time for users to read and act. Success confirmations can disappear quickly. Action buttons need time to click.

commonMistakes.why: Toasts should be temporary, self-dismissing notifications
commonMistakes.impact: Toasts stack up on screen, clutter interface
commonMistakes.fix: Always set timeout to dismiss toast after 3-5 seconds

commonMistakes.why: Toasts auto-dismiss, users might miss important info
commonMistakes.fix: Use modals for critical info that requires acknowledgment

commonMistakes.why: Users need to know what succeeded or failed
User input can contain malicious HTML/scripts
commonMistakes.fix: Use preventXss=true when displaying user content

performanceNotes.description: Showing too many toasts simultaneously impacts performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Limit active toasts to 3-5 maximum. Queue additional toasts and show as others dismiss.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: Multiple animated toasts can slow older devices

performanceNotes.description: Toast auto-dismiss timers must be cleaned up
performanceNotes.recommendation: Clear timeouts in onBeforeUnmount. Store timeout IDs and clear when component unmounts or toast is manually dismissed.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: Uncleaned timers cause memory leaks over time

accessibilityNotes.description: Toasts must announce to screen readers using aria-live
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Toast container should have role='alert' or aria-live='polite' (for non-critical) or aria-live='assertive' (for errors)

accessibilityNotes.description: Action buttons in toasts must be keyboard accessible
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure action buttons can be reached via Tab key. Toast should pause auto-dismiss when focused.

accessibilityNotes.description: Toast text must have sufficient contrast against background
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for text. Test all toast types (success, error, warning, info) for contrast.
accessibilityNotes.example: Use design system color tokens that meet WCAG AA standards

accessibilityNotes.description: Users need time to read and act on toasts
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Provide at least 5 seconds for toasts with action buttons. Allow users to pause/extend timeout on hover or focus.
